message.subject: EXADATA: How to adding new diksgroup from ONE storage cell
message.text:
CT is adding a new storage cell to the cluster. Since the new cell is bigger than the existing ones, they would like to create a new diskgroup from the extra left over space after expanding the existing diskgroups. CT is fully aware of the risk of "single failure group" with this new diskgroup DATA2. However, I was not able to create the new diskgroup as ASM is insisting that I'll need at least two failure groups. How to override and force the new diskgroup creation?
SQL> create diskgroup DATA2 normal redundancy disk 'o/*/DATA2_CD*exps4dst004' attribute 'au_size'='4194304',
'sector_size'='512','compatible.asm'='11.2.0.4.0','compatible.rdbms'='11.2.0.2.0','ce ll.smart_scan_capable'='TRUE',
'content.type'='data';
create diskgroup DATA2 normal redundancy disk 'o/*/DATA2_CD*exps4dst004' attribute 'au_size'='4194304',
*
ERROR at line 1:
ORA-15018: diskgroup cannot be created
ORA-15072: command requires at least 2 regular failure groups, discovered only 1
HYPERLINK "http://www.oracle.com/"Oracle MICHAEL YE | Principal Service Delivery Engineer Phone: HYPERLINK "tel:+1%207817440954"+1 7817440954 | Mobile: HYPERLINK "tel:+1%209783819828"+1 9728165936 Oracle Advanced Customer Services Burlington, Massachusetts

message.subject: Re: Impact of changing MAC
message.text:
No, it should not matter. However, the device name will change, so that does matter. I believe there is a procedure in the manual for changing IP addresses, which would be the same thing, except the device name changes instead of the IP address.
---K
On 8/25/2016 11:00 AM, rakesh sargu wrote: > Hi , > One of my customer have queries on changing Ethernet MAC address ,can > you please share your knowledge on same. > > "We are planning to change Ethernet MAC address in our 3 node RAC > environment with oracle DB and ASM version 11.2.0.4 > We are using the same ip addresses just the Ethernet MAC address will > change for public and backup networks. > IBM Unix will move the ip addresses for the backup and > transactional/public from 1GB to 10GB network cards. > We will keep the same IP address just change the physical cards. > > > Please suggest whether This activity impact oracle RAC environment by > any means > Please suggest what precautions needs to be taken from oracle side ." > > -Rakesh S

message.subject: Re: EXADATA: How to adding new diksgroup from ONE storage cell
message.text:
also, exachk will more than likely complain vigorously every time it is executed on this system.
In particular: "Verify no ASM external redundancy diskgroups exist", and a handful of other storage server checks.
Sincerely, Vern On 8/25/2016 11:05 AM, martin gosejacob wrote: > Hi Michael, > > in addition to Tiberius answer, keep in mind that this falls into the > category of wild hack on Exadata. message.subject: Re: Impact of changing MAC
message.text:
hi Rakesh,
Be mindful of the arp cache. You may be able to flush the cache on the local servers but, the switches also have arp tables that the customer will also have to flush or wait until the entries expire out of the cache on switches in the fabric. Untill all arp caches are flushed, some caches will still have reference to the old MAC.
HTH,
louis
On 8/25/2016 12:00 PM, rakesh sargu wrote: > Hi , > One of my customer have queries on changing Ethernet MAC address ,can > you please share your knowledge on same. > > "We are planning to change Ethernet MAC address in our 3 node RAC > environment with oracle DB and ASM version 11.2.0.4 > We are using the same ip addresses just the Ethernet MAC address will > change for public and backup networks. > IBM Unix will move the ip addresses for the backup and > transactional/public from 1GB to 10GB network cards. > We will keep the same IP address just change the physical cards. > > > Please suggest whether This activity impact oracle RAC environment by > any means > Please suggest what precautions needs to be taken from oracle side ." > > -Rakesh S

message.subject: GI upgrade from 11.2.0.4 -12.1.0.2 non-rolling
message.text:
Hi
I have a customer who wants to do GI upgrade from 11.2.0.4 -12.1.0.2 non-rolling
>From the https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/CWLIN/procstop.htm#CWLIN418
non-rolling Upgrade which involves bringing down all the nodes except one.
A complete cluster outage occurs while the root script stops the old Oracle Clusterware stack and starts the new Oracle Clusterware stack on the node where you initiate the upgrade.
After upgrade is completed, the new Oracle Clusterware is started on all the nodes.
Question here is r does ootupgrade.sh executed only on one node and then we bring up the CRS on all others using 12.1.0.2 binary
Please let me know
Thanks
Amruth Annam ,PMP
Senior Principal Advanced Support Engineer, Exadata & SuperCluster
Phone 1-732-754-6535
cid:part2.06020208.03060301@oracle.com
Announcing Oracle Platinum Services Available at no additional cost on Oracle engineered systems. 24/7 fault monitoring, faster response and restore times, and patch deployment services. Ask me about it or find out more HYPERLINK "http://www.oracle.com/us/support/premier/engineered-systems-solutions/platinum- services/overview/index.html"here!

message.subject: RE: GI upgrade from 11.2.0.4 -12.1.0.2 non-rolling
message.text:
Hi Amruth,
Rootupgrade.sh is run on all the nodes, after completing the first node it can be run in parallel on other nodes except the last.
Thanks,
Tanuj.

message.subject: Re: Switch changes in rolling mode
message.text:
That depends on how they could connected to the switches. Properly configured, replacing a switch would be the same as a switch outage. It might be a god idea to use titis as a practice switch failure. Take the "full outage" opportunity and turn it into a failed switch assurance.
---K
> On Aug 25, 2016, at 11:34 AM, mohammed nizamuddin <mohammed.nizamuddin@oracle.com> wrote: > > Hello Everyone, > > This is 6 nodes connect to two 5k switches (Multi path) > For the network maintenance, network team will change two 5k switches to two 7k switches. > They will change one 5k switch to 7k switch first then change another one. > There are two 5k switches, but network team want this changes by bring all the nodes down and do switch changes. > > Can this changes be done rolling mode ( I mean one after the another) while nodes are up and running. > > Thanks & Regards > Nizamuddin M.d

message.subject: Re: Customer seeking info on XFS vs SLES 12 vs Oracle 12c .
message.text:
There’s plenty of notes on this in the support system… For example. Does this help?
WARNING: Using unsupported filesystems and/or options for Oracle Database or using XFS due to an undocumented defect can cause redo log corruption which can only be detected after it happens when doing a restore or dump of redo log to trace file.
ORA-00283: recovery session canceled due to errors ORA-00368: checksum error in redo log block ORA-00353: log corruption near block 4096 change 21180175 time 03/10/2008 00:14:53
No errors are reported when Oracle is writing the information to the redo logs. If you are using the XFS filesystem, please make sure that you are using the latest update level for the Linux OS and the latest patchset for Oracle DB.
<>SLES11
RDBMS Filesystem I/O Type Supported 10gR2, 11gR1, 11gR2 ext2/ext3 Async I/O Yes (4) reiserfs Yes (1) raw Yes (3) OCFS2 Yes XFS Yes (1) NFS Yes (2) ext2/ext3 Direct I/O (2) Yes (4) reiserfs Yes (1) raw Yes (3) OCFS2 Yes XFS Yes (1) NFS Yes (2)
(1) Oracle does not run certifications on local filesystems (i.e. except for OCFS2, NFS etc.) except ext2/ext3 as it is the common default filesystem for all Linux distributions. So if a problem happens specific to XFS, the Linux vendor should be engaged. (2) Direct I/O is mandatory if the files are on a Network Attached Storage (NAS) (3) raw stands for rawdevices, Automatic Storage Manager (ASM) and ASMLib kernel driver. Note that ASM is inherently asynchronous and the behaviour depends on the DISK_ASYNCH_IO parameter setting. See also Note 47328.1 <https://support.oracle.com/e pmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?parent=DOCUMENT&sourceId=414673.1&id=47328.1> and Note 751463.1 <https://support.oracle.com/epmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?parent=DOCUMENT&sour ceId=414673.1&id=751463.1> (4) SP1 and later: The initial release of SLES 11 provides ext4 as a technology preview and that shall not be used with production workloads. With SP1 of SLES11 kernel version is rebased to 2.6.32 which has the production level ext4 modules. There is no need for an explicit storage certification needed for ext4. (5) According to url http://www.novell.com/linux/releasenotes/s390x/SUSE- SLES/11-SP2/#fate-311111 <http://www.novell.com/linux/releasenotes/s390x/SUSE- SLES/11-SP2/#fate-311111> , ext4 is not supported and read/write is not recommended for Oracle Database Files.
<>Notes
OCFS2: OCFS2 will only work on the 2.6 series of the Linux kernel. As a result, OCFS2 packages are only available for 2.6 based distros. Packages will not be provided for any release of SLES8. More dettails on http://oss.oracle.com/projects/ocfs2/ VARYIO on kernel 2.4 & 2.6: On kernel 2.4 drivers had to support a special bit for varyio. This had to be compiled with the driver to support VARYIO. The complete IO stack is different in kernel 2.6 and this bit is not longer required. VARYIO is not longer driver dependant and all storage (also IDE) will support VARYIO.
Regards
Dom
> On 25 Aug 2016, at 12:01, Srinivasa Nanduri <srinivasa.nanduri@oracle.com> wrote: > > Hello Dominic , > > Thanks for your quick acknowledgement . > Markus confirmed XFS not supported with RAC , since it is not a clustered filesystem. > I would like to know for standalone database . > For the Single Instance Database and its XFS is supported with Oracle 12c and SLES 12 ? > > Thanks > Srinivas > > On 8/25/2016 3:58 PM, Dominic Giles wrote: >> Hi Srinivas >> >> What do you still need assistance with? >> >> Regards >> >> Dom >> >> >> >> >>> On 25 Aug 2016, at 10:46, Srinivasa Nanduri <srinivasa.nanduri@oracle.com <mailto:srinivasa.nanduri@oracle.com>> wrote: >>> >>> Hello Team , >>> >>> Please suggest me on the below customer query . >>> >>> Thanks >>> Srinivas >>> >>> On 8/24/2016 1:32 AM, Markus Michalewicz wrote: >>>> Hello Srinivas, >>>> >>>> As XFS is not a cluster file system, it cannot be used for RAC database files. >>>> >>>> It can be used for database binaries, but I doubt that this is the question here. >>>> >>>> For the Single Instance Database and its XFS support, I have included oracle12c_us_grp. >>>> >>>> Hope that helps. message.subject: Re: Customer seeking info on XFS vs SLES 12 vs Oracle 12c .
message.text:
The support system has plenty of info on this…
i.e. the following support note details the requirements for SLES12 and Oracle Database 12c.
Doc ID 2128624.1
Typically we support everything thats gone before i.e. Filesystems etc. unless we explicitly call it out in the release notes or install guide.
If you look in the support system (one more time) you can see that we don’t appear to explicitly change our policy on XFS. At least not that I can see. If anyone else wants to flag something up… go ahead.
Regards
Dom
> On 25 Aug 2016, at 14:47, Srinivasa Nanduri <srinivasa.nanduri@oracle.com> wrote: > > Hello Dominic , > > Thanks for the response . > Plenty of notes available for previous versions of Oracle and SLES but customer wanting to know the XFS certification on Oracle 12c and SLES 12 . > > Thanks > Srinivas > > On 8/25/2016 6:48 PM, Dominic Giles wrote: >> There’s plenty of notes on this in the support system… For example. Does this help? >> >> >> WARNING: Using unsupported filesystems and/or options for Oracle Database or using XFS due to an undocumented defect can cause redo log corruption which can only be detected after it happens when doing a restore or dump of redo log to trace file. >> >> ORA-00283: recovery session canceled due to errors >> ORA-00368: checksum error in redo log block >> ORA-00353: log corruption near block 4096 change 21180175 time 03/10/2008 00:14:53 >> >> No errors are reported when Oracle is writing the information to the redo logs. If you are using the XFS filesystem, please make sure that you are using the latest update level for the Linux OS and the latest patchset for Oracle DB. >> >> <>SLES11 >> >> RDBMS Filesystem I/O Type Supported >> 10gR2, 11gR1, 11gR2 ext2/ext3 Async I/O Yes (4) >> reiserfs Yes (1) >> raw Yes (3) >> OCFS2 Yes >> XFS Yes (1) >> NFS Yes (2) >> ext2/ext3 Direct I/O (2) Yes (4) >> reiserfs Yes (1) >> raw Yes (3) >> OCFS2 Yes >> XFS Yes (1) >> NFS Yes (2) >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> >> (1) Oracle does not run certifications on local filesystems (i.e. except for OCFS2, NFS etc.) except ext2/ext3 as it is the common >> default filesystem for all Linux distributions. So if a problem happens specific to XFS, the Linux vendor should be engaged. >> (2) Direct I/O is mandatory if the files are on a Network Attached Storage (NAS) >> (3) raw stands for rawdevices, Automatic Storage Manager (ASM) and ASMLib kernel driver. Note that ASM is inherently asynchronous and the behaviour depends on the DISK_ASYNCH_IO parameter setting. See also Note 47328.1 <https://support.oracle.com/e pmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?parent=DOCUMENT&sourceId=414673.1&id=47328.1> and Note 751463.1 <https://support.oracle.com/epmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?parent=DOCUMENT&sour ceId=414673.1&id=751463.1> >> (4) SP1 and later: The initial release of SLES 11 provides ext4 as a technology preview and that shall not be used with production workloads. This had to be compiled with the driver to support VARYIO. The complete IO stack is different in kernel 2.6 and this bit is not longer required. message.subject: Re: Customer seeking info on XFS vs SLES 12 vs Oracle 12c .
message.text:
Hello Dominic ,
Thanks for your quick acknowledgement .
Markus confirmed XFS not supported with RAC , since it is not a clustered filesystem.
I would like to know for standalone database .
For the Single Instance Database and its XFS is supported with Oracle 12c and SLES 12 ?
Thanks Srinivas

message.subject: Re: EXADATA: How to adding new diksgroup from ONE storage cell
message.text:
Hi Michael,
in addition to Tiberius answer, keep in mind that this falls into the category of wild hack on Exadata. Any time this storage server is offline for whatever reason that disk group in inaccessible.
By the way ASM will allow a single failure group only for redundancy level 'external'.
Cheers Martin
On 25.08.2016 17:22, Tiberiu Atudorei wrote: > Don't use wilcards but add by disk name and create at least 2 > failgroups.. for instance failgroup1 with odd disk and failgroup2 with > even disks: CREATE DISKGROUP TEST NORMAL REDUNDANCY FAILGROUP testfg1 > DISK '/o/IP/CD00exps4dst04' , '/o/IP/CD02exps4dst04', > '/o/IP/CD04exps4dst04' FAILGROUP testfg2 DISK '/o/IP/CD01exps4dst04' , > '/o/IP/CD03exps4dst04', '/o/IP/CD06exps4dst04'; > ----- Original Message ----- > From: michael.m.ye@oracle.com > To: "acsci_esperts_ww_grp" <acsci_esperts_ww_grp@oracle.com>, > helpasm_ww@oracle.com, exadata_triage_ww@oracle.com > Sent: Thursday, August 25, 2016 6:12:19 PM GMT +02:00 Athens, Beirut, > Bucharest, Istanbul > Subject: EXADATA: How to adding new diksgroup from ONE storage cell > > CT is adding a new storage cell to the cluster. Since the new cell is > bigger than the existing ones, they would like to create a new > diskgroup from the extra left over space after expanding the existing > diskgroups. CT is fully aware of the risk of “single failure group” > with this new diskgroup DATA2. However, I was not able to create the > new diskgroup as ASM is insisting that I’ll need at least two failure > groups. *How to override and force the new diskgroup creation?* > > SQL> create diskgroup DATA2 normal redundancy disk > 'o/*/DATA2_CD*exps4dst004' attribute 'au_size'='4194304', > > ‘sector_size'='512','compatible.asm'='11.2.0.4.0','compatible.rdbms'='11.2.0.2.0',' cell.smart_scan_capable'='TRUE', > > 'content.type'='data'; > > create diskgroup DATA2 normal redundancy disk > 'o/*/DATA2_CD*exps4dst004' attribute 'au_size'='4194304', > > * > > ERROR at line 1: > > ORA-15018: diskgroup cannot be created > > ORA-15072: command requires at least 2 regular failure groups, > discovered only 1 > > Oracle <http://www.oracle.com/> > MICHAEL YE | Principal Service Delivery Engineer > Phone: +1 7817440954 <about:blank> | Mobile: +1 9728165936 <about:blank> > OracleAdvanced Customer Services > Burlington, Massachusetts >
-- <http://www.oracle.com> Martin Gosejacob | Principal Sales Consultant Phone: +49 89 1430 1887 <tel:+49%2089%201430%201887> Oracle STU

message.subject: Re: Stop auto_start for ora.crf (CHM)
message.text:
Customers are not permitted to managed ora.* resources via crsctl as they are currently doing. It is also not supported to disable CHM, regardless of QoS or MPA usage, as it provides critical O/S data via diagcollect to Oracle Support. Please advise the customer that they are running an unsupported environment by disabling the ora.crf resource.
Thanks,
Mark
Mark V. Scardina | Director, Product Management | 1.650.506.2993
Oracle QoS Management & Oracle Autonomous Health Framework 500 Oracle Parkway | Redwood Shores, CA 94065 Oracle is committed to developing practices and products that help protect the environment
From: tomohiro ueda <tomohiro.ueda@oracle.com> Organization: Oracle Corporation Date: Thursday, August 25, 2016 at 5:42 PM To: helprac_ww_grp <helprac_ww_grp@oracle.com> Cc: YUTAKEDA <yukie.takeda@oracle.com> Subject: Stop auto_start for ora.crf (CHM)
Hi, experts
IHAC who stops auto_start for ora.crf resource, and I have question about support status of this operation.
Customer's configuration is as follows.
* Grid Infrastructure 11.2.0.4
* Stop to gather info via CHM by following command.
# crsctl modify resource ora.crf -attr AUTO_START=never -init
Background of above configuration is as follows.
* customer does not use features which require CHM (like Qos, MPA)
* customer would like to stop redundant processes for managing their systems and server resources.
* Doc ID 20186278.8 is reported as bug of CHM feature.
And my question is.
Q. stopping ora.crf resource is supported ?
I understand that this is not recommended operations, and customer should consider to enable ora.crf.
But this is production system, and it is difficult to enable ora.crs immediately.
And we'd like to know whether current configuration (ora.crf is disabled) is supported or not.
"Supported" means that customer is able to log SR or BUG under this configuration.
Could you give us any advice about this question ?
And this is not supported, that is mentioned in any public documents ?
Thanks,
Tomohiro
--
Tomohiro Ueda
* Principal Technical Support Engineer
* Database 1 DB Systems
* Database Technology Support
* Customer Support Services
* ORACLE CORPORATION JAPAN

message.subject: Re: Stop auto_start for ora.crf (CHM)
message.text:
The list of supported crsctl commands is documented in the Oracle Clusterware Control (CRSCTL) Utility Reference section of the Clusterware Admininstration and Deployment Guide. The command the customer is using is not listed, therefore it is not supported. I have asked the owner of the CHM FAQ to update to reflect that that command is for internal visibility only.
Regards,
Mark
Mark V. Scardina | Director, Product Management | 1.650.506.2993
Oracle QoS Management & Oracle Autonomous Health Framework 500 Oracle Parkway | Redwood Shores, CA 94065 Oracle is committed to developing practices and products that help protect the environment
From: tomohiro ueda <tomohiro.ueda@oracle.com> Organization: Oracle Corporation Date: Thursday, August 25, 2016 at 6:20 PM To: Mark Scardina <mark.scardina@oracle.com>, helprac_ww_grp <helprac_ww_grp@oracle.com> Cc: YUTAKEDA <yukie.takeda@oracle.com> Subject: Re: Stop auto_start for ora.crf (CHM)
Hi, Mark
Thanks for your advice. That is mentioned in any public document ? For example, diable command is mentioned in following document.
------- Cluster Health Monitor (CHM) FAQ (Doc ID 1328466.1)
To disable: #<GRID_HOME>/bin/crsctl modify resource ora.crf -attr "AUTO_START=never" -init -------
How is customer able to know that disabling ora.crf is not supported ?
Thanks, Tomohiro
On 2016/08/26 10:12, Mark Scardina wrote:
Customers are not permitted to managed ora.* resources via crsctl as they are currently doing. It is also not supported to disable CHM, regardless of QoS or MPA usage, as it provides critical O/S data via diagcollect to Oracle Support. message.subject: Re: ** RELEASED!!! ** DB RAC TEMPLATES 11.2.0.4.160719 / 12.1.0.2.160719 EE&SE2 / 12.2.0.1.0 + OL6U8 / OL7U2
message.text:
Folks,
With great pleasure we are happy to announce the (long awaited) release of the 3 DB/RAC OVM Templates below, representing latest software released to date:
> ol6u8+12.1.0.2.July PSU SE2 > ol7u2+12.1.0.2.July PSU EE > ol6u8+11.2.0.4.July PSU EE
>> Mirrors: >> >> HQ based mirror: ftp://strrac01.us.oracle.com/ovm/test >> EU based mirror: http://goofy.nl.oracle.com/shares/export/iso/ovm/test/
Sadly, strrac01 mirror suffered an I/O error, so it is down until we figure things :) :)
The goofy host mirror is OK! Don't ask about the name :) it's goofy, but it works!!
The bits are definitely on ARU, ready for customer download, and MOS note updated:
Oracle VM Templates for Oracle Database - Single Instance, Oracle Restart (SIHA) and Oracle RAC (Doc ID 1185244.1)
The OTN page has been approved as well:
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/server-storage/vm/database-templates-12c- 11gr2-1972804.html
All these have this fix:
Bug 23307036 - HVM:uek4 real-time processing appear different; causing RAC/CRS 2 spin/cpu/crash
critical for RAC running in HVM mode, which everyone should be by now...
Feel free to blog, let your customers know, etc.
HUGE HUGE thanks to all the teams involved. Seriously, if I had to name individual people, the list would be very long, although I've done that in the past, this time, just mention teams by area..
* Patchset build team, awasome, amazing direct, 24/7 support!
* OPatch, datapatch, great stuff, very reactive...and some old timers..
* OUI / DBCA, tools, great folks, super support!!
* Linux kernel, PMs/ OVM - Well. they have no choice, they *have* to help me :) :) Just kidding, they (still) love me - I think :)
* Openstack - YES, they've in there involved as well (without even knowing :), more to come soon :)
Huge thanks, really, also on behalf of the MANY customers using these.
Each time, it feels like, OK, this is just going to be smooth sailing, nothing to it, just apply the PSU, update OS bits, and zip it up :)
Roughly speaking, that's it, but underneath.. lots of work by many folks, even if they don't really know it..
Now going to rest a bit :) bake some bread...
no bug reports for a week pls :) :) just kidding.. anytime... glad to help!
Until 12.2... this may take some time, it will not be same day as 12.2 goes out, that is for sure...

message.subject: How to tune this Orion run duration?
message.text:
Hi Gurus,
Customer is planning to run Orion with the following parameters for a mixed workload. The estimated duration is 404 minutes. Any suggestions to reduce the duration, with minimum sacrifice in functionality?
$ ./orion -run advanced -testname mytest -num_disks 6 -size_small 8 -size_large 1024 -type rand -simulate raid0 -matrix detailed
Tried removing the "-matrix detailed" can shorten the duration a lot, but customer really want a mixed workload.
Thanks and Regards,
Siu Pong

message.subject: Re: Customer seeking info on XFS vs SLES 12 vs Oracle 12c .
message.text:
Hello Dominic ,
Thanks for the response .
Plenty of notes available for previous versions of Oracle and SLES but customer wanting to know the XFS certification on Oracle 12c and SLES 12 .
Thanks Srinivas
On 8/25/2016 6:48 PM, Dominic Giles wrote: > There’s plenty of notes on this in the support system… For example. > Does this help? > > > *WARNING:* Using unsupported filesystems and/or options for Oracle > Database or using XFS due to an undocumented defect can cause redo log > corruption which can only be detected after it happens when doing a > restore or dump of redo log to trace file. > > ORA-00283: recovery session canceled due to errors > ORA-00368: checksum error in redo log block > ORA-00353: log corruption near block 4096 change 21180175 time > 03/10/2008 00:14:53 > > No errors are reported when Oracle is writing the information to the > redo logs. If you are using the XFS filesystem, please make sure that > you are using the latest update level for the Linux OS and the latest > patchset for Oracle DB. > > > SLES11 > > RDBMS Filesystem I/O Type Supported > 10gR2, 11gR1, 11gR2 ext2/ext3 Async I/O Yes (4) > reiserfs Yes (1) > raw Yes (3) > OCFS2 Yes > XFS Yes (1) > NFS Yes (2) > ext2/ext3 Direct I/O (2) Yes (4) > reiserfs Yes (1) > raw Yes (3) > OCFS2 Yes > XFS Yes (1) > NFS Yes (2) > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > (1) Oracle does not run certifications on local filesystems (i.e. > except for OCFS2, NFS etc.) except ext2/ext3 as it is the common > default filesystem for all Linux distributions. So if a problem > happens specific to XFS, the Linux vendor should be engaged. > (2) Direct I/O is mandatory if the files are on a Network Attached > Storage (NAS) > (3) raw stands for rawdevices, Automatic Storage Manager (ASM) and > ASMLib kernel driver. Note that ASM is inherently asynchronous and the > behaviour depends on the DISK_ASYNCH_IO parameter setting. See also > Note 47328.1 > <https://support.oracle.com/epmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?parent=DOCUMENT&sourceId=41 4673.1&id=47328.1> and > Note 751463.1 > <https://support.oracle.com/epmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?parent=DOCUMENT&sourceId=41 4673.1&id=751463.1> > (4) SP1 and later: The initial release of SLES 11 provides ext4 as a > technology preview and that shall not be used with production > workloads. With SP1 of SLES11 kernel version is rebased to 2.6.32 > which has the production level ext4 modules. There is no need for an > explicit storage certification needed for ext4. > (5) According to url > http://www.novell.com/linux/releasenotes/s390x/SUSE-SLES/11-SP2/#fate-311111 , > ext4 is not supported and read/write is not recommended for Oracle > Database Files. > > > Notes > > * OCFS2: OCFS2 will only work on the 2.6 series of the Linux > kernel. As a result, OCFS2 packages are only available for 2.6 > based distros. Packages will not be provided for any release of > SLES8. More dettails on http://oss.oracle.com/projects/ocfs2/ > * VARYIO on kernel 2.4 & 2.6: On kernel 2.4 drivers had to support a > special bit for varyio. This had to be compiled with the driver > to support VARYIO. The complete IO stack is different in kernel > 2.6 and this bit is not longer required. VARYIO is not longer > driver dependant and all storage (also IDE) will support VARYIO. > > > > Regards > > Dom > > > > >> On 25 Aug 2016, at 12:01, Srinivasa Nanduri >> <srinivasa.nanduri@oracle.com <mailto:srinivasa.nanduri@oracle.com>> >> wrote: >> >> Hello Dominic , >> >> Thanks for your quick acknowledgement . >> >> Markus confirmed XFS not supported with RAC , since it is not a >> clustered filesystem. >> >> I would like to know for standalone database . >> >> For the Single Instance Database and its XFS is supported with >> Oracle 12c and SLES 12 ? >> >> Thanks >> Srinivas >> >> On 8/25/2016 3:58 PM, Dominic Giles wrote: >>> Hi Srinivas >>> >>> What do you still need assistance with? >>> >>> Regards >>> >>> Dom >>> >>> >>> >>> >>>> On 25 Aug 2016, at 10:46, Srinivasa Nanduri >>>> <srinivasa.nanduri@oracle.com >>>> <mailto:srinivasa.nanduri@oracle.com>> wrote: >>>> >>>> Hello Team , >>>> >>>> Please suggest me on the below customer query . >>>> >>>> Thanks >>>> Srinivas >>>> >>>> On 8/24/2016 1:32 AM, Markus Michalewicz wrote: >>>>> Hello Srinivas, >>>>> >>>>> As XFS is not a cluster file system, it cannot be used for RAC >>>>> database files. >>>>> >>>>> It can be used for database binaries, but I doubt that this is the >>>>> question here. >>>>> >>>>> For the Single Instance Database and its XFS support, I have >>>>> included oracle12c_us_grp. >>>>> >>>>> Hope that helps. Thank you, >>>>> Markus >>>>> >>>>> <Mail Attachment.gif> <http://www.oracle.com/> >>>>> Markus Michalewicz | Senior Director of Product Management >>>>> Oracle Real Application Clusters, ST Development >>>>> Phone: +16505065444 <tel:+16505065444> | Mobile: +16502937832 >>>>> <tel:+16502937832> >>>>> 500 Oracle Parkway M/S 4OP1004 | Redwood Shores, CA 94065 >>>>> <Mail Attachment.png>Connect with me on LinkedIn >>>>> <https://www.linkedin.com/pub/markus-michalewicz/4/99a/a99> | >>>>> Twitter (@OracleRACpm) <https://twitter.com/OracleRACpm> >>>>> >>>>> On 8/23/16 3:30 AM, Srinivasa Nanduri wrote: >>>>>> Hello Team , >>>>>> >>>>>> Customer would like to know whether XFS is supported in >>>>>> combination with SLES 12 and Oracle 12c . >>>>>> Unfortunately I didn't find any official MOS Note on the >>>>>> same. I have not been able to find any relevant document that >>>>>> mention more information. >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>>> Below is the customer's query from SR# 3-13186837491 >>>>>> ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ +++++++++++++++++ >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>>> Hello Srinivas, >>>>>> >>>>>> we Need an official Statement from Oracle whether XFS is >>>>>> supported with Oracle 12c and SLES 12 or not. >>>>>> Is there a possibility to obtain These ? Perhaps in >>>>>> collaboration with the development Team ? >>>>>> >>>>>> Regards, >>>>>> Lars >>>>>> >>>>>> ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ ++++++++++++++++++ >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>>> Please update me with the above info . >>>>>> >>>>>> Thanks >>>>>> Srinivas >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>> >>>> >>> >> >

message.subject: How to drop the ASM DISK when ASCII Character Involved.
message.text:
Hi All,
One of the customer want to drop an ASM disk which resides on old storage. However, the disk cannot be dropped as we cannot use the command to drop the disk with the strange character:
SQL> alter diskgroup data drop disk 'data_0014' rebalance power 11; alter diskgroup data drop disk *'data_**▒**0014' *rebalance power 11 *<=====* * ERROR at line 1: ORA-15032: not all alterations performed ORA-15054: disk "DATA_▒0014" does not exist in diskgroup "DATA"
+++ SQL> select 'alter diskgroup data drop disk '''||name||''' rebalance power 11' from v$asm_disk where GROUP_NUMBER = 2;
'ALTERDISKGROUPDATADROPDISK'''||NAME||'''REBALANCEPOWER11' -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA08' rebalance power 11 alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA03' rebalance power 11 alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA02' rebalance power 11 alter diskgroup data drop disk *'DATA_▒0014' *rebalance power 11 *<===== *alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA14' rebalance power 11
+++ SQL> select path,name,header_status from v$asm_disk where group_number=2; PATH ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------- NAME HEADER_STATU ------------------------------ ------------ /oracleasm/data08/data08 DATA08 MEMBER /oracleasm/data03/data03 DATA03 MEMBER /oracleasm/data02/data02 DATA02 MEMBER /oracleasm/data_15/data15 DATA_▒0014 MEMBER /oracleasm/data14/data14 DATA14 MEMBER +++ As per ASM logs,they added a new disk with special character into DATA diskgroup Thu May 19 12:57:31 2016 SQL> alter diskgroup data add disk '/oracleasm/data_15/data15' name DATA_°014 rebalance power 11 NOTE: Assigning number (1,15) to disk (/oracleasm/data_15/data15) NOTE: requesting all-instance membership refresh for group=1 Kindly follow below step and let me know the output.** +++ The ASCII character behind is 194: SQL> select dump(name) from v$asm_disk where name like '%0014%'; DUMP(NAME) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Typ=1 Len=10: 68,65,84,65,95,194,48,48,49,52 However, how can we run the drop statement for this disk containing the strange character? +++ We tried following steps and didn't work . a) SQL> alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_°014' rebalance power 11; alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_°014' rebalance power 11 * ERROR at line 1: ORA-15032: not all alterations performed ORA-15054: disk "DATA_°014" does not exist in diskgroup "DATA" b) SQL> alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_xC20014' rebalance power 11; alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_xC20014' rebalance power 11 * ERROR at line 1: ORA-15032: not all alterations performed ORA-15054: disk "DATA_XC20014" does not exist in diskgroup "DATA" c) SQL> alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_Â0014' rebalance power 11; alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_Â0014' rebalance power 11 * ERROR at line 1: ORA-15032: not all alterations performed ORA-15054: disk "DATA_Â0014" does not exist in diskgroup "DATA" ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------- GI version 11.2.0.2 with PSU 11.2.0.2.12 (17082367), running 11.2.0.2 and 10.2.0.5 databases. Linux x86-64/ Red Hat Enterprise 5 DG--> *External **Redundancy*******kfdhdb.grptyp: 1 ; 0x026: KFDGTP_EXTERNAL kfdhdb.hdrsts: 3 ; 0x027: KFDHDR_MEMBER kfdhdb.dskname: DATA_▒0014 ; 0x028: length=10 kfdhdb.grpname: DATA ; 0x048: length=4 kfdhdb.fgname: DATA_▒0014 ; 0x068: length=10 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------- Thanks, Gobinath

SQL> alter diskgroup data drop disk 'data_0014' rebalance power 11; alter diskgroup data drop disk *'data_**▒**0014' *rebalance power 11 *<=====* * ERROR at line 1: ORA-15032: not all alterations performed ORA-15054: disk "DATA_▒0014" does not exist in diskgroup "DATA"
+++ SQL> select 'alter diskgroup data drop disk '''||name||''' rebalance power 11' from v$asm_disk where GROUP_NUMBER = 2;
'ALTERDISKGROUPDATADROPDISK'''||NAME||'''REBALANCEPOWER11' -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA08' rebalance power 11 alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA03' rebalance power 11 alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA02' rebalance power 11 alter diskgroup data drop disk *'DATA_▒0014' *rebalance power 11 *<===== *alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA14' rebalance power 11
+++ SQL> select path,name,header_status from v$asm_disk where group_number=2; MEMBER /oracleasm/data_15/data15 DATA_▒0014 MEMBER /oracleasm/data14/data14 DATA14 MEMBER +++ As per ASM logs,they added a new disk with special character into DATA diskgroup Thu May 19 12:57:31 2016 SQL> alter diskgroup data add disk '/oracleasm/data_15/data15' name DATA_°014 rebalance power 11 NOTE: Assigning number (1,15) to disk (/oracleasm/data_15/data15) NOTE: requesting all-instance membership refresh for group=1 +++ The ASCII character behind is 194: SQL> select dump(name) from v$asm_disk where name like '%0014%'; DUMP(NAME) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Typ=1 Len=10: 68,65,84,65,95,194,48,48,49,52 However, how can we run the drop statement for this disk containing the strange character? +++ We tried following steps and didn't work . a) SQL> alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_°014' rebalance power 11; alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_°014' rebalance power 11 * ERROR at line 1: ORA-15032: not all alterations performed ORA-15054: disk "DATA_°014" does not exist in diskgroup "DATA" b) SQL> alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_xC20014' rebalance power 11; alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_xC20014' rebalance power 11 * ERROR at line 1: ORA-15032: not all alterations performed ORA-15054: disk "DATA_XC20014" does not exist in diskgroup "DATA" c) SQL> alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_Â0014' rebalance power 11; alter diskgroup data drop disk 'DATA_Â0014' rebalance power 11 * ERROR at line 1: ORA-15032: not all alterations performed ORA-15054: disk "DATA_Â0014" does not exist in diskgroup "DATA" ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------- GI version 11.2.0.2 with PSU 11.2.0.2.12 (17082367), running 11.2.0.2 and 10.2.0.5 databases. Linux x86-64/ Red Hat Enterprise 5 DG--> *External **Redundancy******* kfdhdb.grptyp: 1 ; 0x026: KFDGTP_EXTERNAL kfdhdb.hdrsts: 3 ; 0x027: KFDHDR_MEMBER kfdhdb.dskname: DATA_▒0014 ; 0x028: length=10 kfdhdb.grpname: DATA ; 0x048: length=4 kfdhdb.fgname: DATA_▒0014 ; 0x068: length=10 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------- Thanks, Gobinath

message.subject: Impact of changing MAC
message.text:
Hi , One of my customer have queries on changing Ethernet MAC address ,can you please share your knowledge on same.
"We are planning to change Ethernet MAC address in our 3 node RAC environment with oracle DB and ASM version 11.2.0.4 We are using the same ip addresses just the Ethernet MAC address will change for public and backup networks. IBM Unix will move the ip addresses for the backup and transactional/public from 1GB to 10GB network cards. We will keep the same IP address just change the physical cards.
Please suggest whether This activity impact oracle RAC environment by any means Please suggest what precautions needs to be taken from oracle side ."
-Rakesh S
